nodes.bodyText: can we use ignored? That is what IntelliJ expects.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -329,7 +329,7 @@
         </module>
         <module name="EmptyCatchBlock">
             <property name="severity" value="warning"/>
-            <property name="exceptionVariableName" value="expected"/>
+            <property name="exceptionVariableName" value="expected|ignore"/>

nodes.bodyText:
The official example here uses ignore.  So I want to follow the convention.
https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_blocks.html
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -329,7 +329,7 @@
         </module>
         <module name="EmptyCatchBlock">
             <property name="severity" value="warning"/>
-            <property name="exceptionVariableName" value="expected"/>
+            <property name="exceptionVariableName" value="expected|ignore"/>

nodes.bodyText: This is not good, I think this method should throw.
